intro: Cnicus provosti, commonly known as the Provost's thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow flower heads. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in dry, rocky soils and full sun. The plant produces small, composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
